channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024020392
item.description:
Report E-2024020392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approx 4 ounces of acid shine released from four 55-gallon poly drums because of loose caps that won't tighten. The release impacted the poly drum. No Drains, Soils, or Waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024020330
item.description:
Report X-2024020330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: OAK PARK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found leaking pack in van while making his deliveries. Package was found by QA when doing VSA. DescribePack: 1 out of 4 jugs of Morado super cleaner had a loose cap and leaked. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and sent to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020388
item.description:
Report X-2024020388

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: STERLING HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The trailer was being unloaded on the inbound sort during which the 5 gallon drum was placed on a flat tray for stability and sent down the line toward the designated work area. Upon the arrival to the work area it was noticed that the lid on the drum was dented and a very minor amount of the product was leaking and on the side of the drum. QA was contacted where the drum was placed in a tote lined with spill pads and removed from the area DescribePack: The lid is dented at the edge about 1.5 inches in length DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA was contacted where the drum was placed in a tote lined with spill pads and removed from the area
